For as <S%H3605>long<s%> <S%H5750><s%> as <S%H5397>life<s%> is in me, And the <S%H5397>breath<s%> of <S%H433>God<s%> is in my <S%H639>nostrils,<s%>
My <S%H8193>lips<s%> <S%H518>certainly<s%> will not <S%H1696>speak<s%> <S%H9390>unjustly,<s%> <S%H518>Nor<s%> will my <S%H3956>tongue<s%> <S%H1897>mutter<s%> <S%H7423>deceit.<s%>

<S%H2486>"Far<s%> be it from me that I should <S%H6663>declare<s%> you <S%H6663>right;<s%> <S%H5704>Till<s%> I <S%H1478>die<s%> I will not <S%H5493>put<s%> <S%H5493>away<s%> my <S%H8538>integrity<s%> from me.

"May my <S%H340>enemy<s%> be as the <S%H7563>wicked,<s%> And my <S%H6965>opponent<s%> as the <S%H5767>unjust.<s%>

"For <S%H4100>what<s%> is the <S%H8615>hope<s%> of the <S%H2611>godless<s%> <S%H3588>when<s%> he is <S%H1214>cut<s%> <S%H1214>off,<s%> <S%H3588>When<s%> <S%H433>God<s%> <S%H7953>requires<s%> his <S%H5315>life<s%>?

"Will he <S%H6026>take<s%> <S%H6026>delight<s%> in the <S%H7706>Almighty,<s%> Will he <S%H7121>call<s%> on <S%H433>God<s%> at <S%H3605>all<s%> <S%H6256>times<s%>?
"I will <S%H3384>instruct<s%> you in the <S%H3027>power<s%> of <S%H410>God;<s%> <S%H834>What<s%> is with the <S%H7706>Almighty<s%> I will not <S%H3582>conceal.<s%>
<S%H2005>"Behold,<s%> <S%H3605>all<s%> of you have <S%H2372>seen<s%> [it;] <S%H4100>Why<s%> <S%H2088>then<s%> do you <S%H1891>act<s%> <S%H1891>foolishly<s%>?

<S%H2088>"This<s%> is the <S%H2506>portion<s%> of a <S%H7563>wicked<s%> <S%H120>man<s%> from <S%H410>God,<s%> And the <S%H5159>inheritance<s%> [which] <S%H6184>tyrants<s%> <S%H3947>receive<s%> from the <S%H7706>Almighty.<s%>

<S%H518>"Though<s%> his <S%H1121>sons<s%> are <S%H7235>many,<s%> they are destined for the <S%H2719>sword;<s%> And his <S%H6631>descendants<s%> will not be <S%H7646>satisfied<s%> with <S%H3899>bread.<s%>
"His <S%H8300>survivors<s%> will be <S%H6912>buried<s%> because of the <S%H4194>plague,<s%> And their <S%H490>widows<s%> will not be able to <S%H1058>weep.<s%>
<S%H518>"Though<s%> he <S%H6651>piles<s%> up <S%H3701>silver<s%> like <S%H6083>dust,<s%> And <S%H3559>prepares<s%> <S%H4403>garments<s%> as [plentiful as] the <S%H2563>clay;<s%>
He may <S%H3559>prepare<s%> [it,] but the <S%H6662>just<s%> will <S%H3847>wear<s%> [it,] And the <S%H9345>innocent<s%> will <S%H2505>divide<s%> the <S%H3701>silver.<s%>
"He has <S%H1129>built<s%> his <S%H1004>house<s%> like the spider's web, Or as a <S%H5521>hut<s%> [which] the <S%H5341>watchman<s%> has <S%H6213>made.<s%>
"He <S%H7901>lies<s%> <S%H7901>down<s%> <S%H6223>rich,<s%> but <S%H3808>never<s%> <S%H622>again;<s%> He <S%H6491>opens<s%> his <S%H5869>eyes,<s%> and it is <S%H369>no<s%> <S%H369>more.<s%>
<S%H1091>"Terrors<s%> <S%H5381>overtake<s%> him like a <S%H4325>flood;<s%> A <S%H5492>tempest<s%> <S%H1589>steals<s%> him <S%H1589>away<s%> in the <S%H3915>night.<s%>
"The <S%H6921>east<s%> <S%H6921>wind<s%> <S%H5375>carries<s%> him away, and he is <S%H1980>gone,<s%> For it <S%H9621>whirls<s%> him <S%H9621>away<s%> from his <S%H4725>place.<s%>
"For it will <S%H7993>hurl<s%> at him <S%H3808>without<s%> <S%H2550>sparing;<s%> He will <S%H1272>surely<s%> try to <S%H1272>flee<s%> from its <S%H3027>power.<s%>
"[Men] will <S%H5606>clap<s%> their <S%H3709>hands<s%> at him, And will <S%H8319>hiss<s%> him from his <S%H4725>place.<s%>
